meanings.definition: An acting game in which players guess a word or phrase based on gestures and movements.
meanings.sent1: During the party, we played charades and had to act out 'penguin'.
meanings.sent2: At the family gathering, we always enjoy a round of charades to guess the secret word.
meanings.sent3: The children's charades game became hilarious when the dog tried to mimic a cat.
meanings.sent4: Her charades performance was so convincing, it was like watching a silent movie come to life.
meanings.sent5: The charades round was so intense that everyone was on the edge of their seats, trying to guess the word.

meanings.definition: Pretending to be someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: She put on a charades disguise and pretended to be a superhero for the costume party.
meanings.sent2: The charades prince walked around the room, greeting guests with a regal air.
meanings.sent3: His charades attempt at being a robot was so convincing, we almost believed he was mechanical.
meanings.sent4: In the charades of life, sometimes we all wear masks to hide our true selves.
meanings.sent5: The charades performance was so authentic that it was hard to tell where reality ended and acting began.
